name: Calculus I
description: This course introduces students to the principles of calculus, including limits, derivatives, and integrals.

name: Calculus II
description: This course covers more advanced topics in calculus, including techniques of integration, infinite series, and analytic geometry.

name: Linear Algebra
description: This course introduces students to the principles of linear algebra, including matrices, vectors, vector spaces, and linear transformations.

name: Differential Equations
description: This course covers the principles of differential equations, including first order equations, second and higher order equations, systems of differential equations, and partial differential equations.

name: Classical Mechanics
description: This course introduces students to classical mechanics, including Newton's laws of motion, energy, momentum, rotational dynamics, and oscillations. This course also covers Lagrange's equations and Hamilton's equations.

name: Electromagnetism
description: This course covers the principles of electromagnetism, including electric fields, magnetic fields, and electromagnetic waves.

name: Quantum Mechanics
description: This course introduces students to quantum mechanics, including wave-particle duality, Schr√∂dinger's equation, operators, and the hydrogen atom.

name: Statistical Mechanics
description: This course covers the principles of statistical mechanics, including classical and quantum statistics, the partition function, and phase transitions.

name: General Relativity
description: This course introduces students to the principles of general relativity, including curved spacetime, tensor analysis, and the Einstein field equations.
